key_points: Rory McIlroy expresses that Tiger Woods can still positively influence golf, even if his competitive career ends due to his recent car crash.
Tiger Woods is currently hospitalized in California with significant injuries to his right leg after a car accident in Los Angeles.
Injuries to Woods' leg required the insertion of rods, screws, and pins.
Los Angeles County Sheriff Alex Villanueva described Woods' survival as 'miraculous' and stated the crash was 'purely an accident'.
Sheriff Villanueva also confirmed Woods will not face criminal charges.
McIlroy emphasizes the importance of Woods' survival and well-being over his return to golf.
McIlroy reflects on the eventual transition the golf world will face without Woods' participation in tournaments.
McIlroy suggests Woods could still contribute to golf through his design business, foundation, and hosting tournaments.
McIlroy highlights the struggles Woods overcame to win the Masters in 2019.
PGA Tour Commissioner Jay Monahan emphasizes the importance of Woods' recovery and well-being.
